question.title: Passing ordinary value from jsp to Servlet using jquery

node.contents: are you sure the id is correct? what type of element is element with id=facilityId?

astNode.text: are you sure the id is correct? what type of element is element with id=facilityId?

node.contents: In the code you posted you have no component that has a `facilityId` id. That's why you get the error in `$('#facilityId')` jQuery syntax.

astNode.text: In the code you posted you have no component that has a `facilityId` id. That's why you get the error in `$('#facilityId')` jQuery syntax.

node.contents: @LuiggiMendoza the variable does exist in my code . I updated the question .

astNode.text: @LuiggiMendoza the variable does exist in my code . I updated the question .

node.contents: You're confusing server side variables with client side variables. jQuery can only access to client side variables i.e. components generated in HTML.

astNode.text: You're confusing server side variables with client side variables. jQuery can only access to client side variables i.e. components generated in HTML.

node.contents: By the way, you would want to review [How to avoid Java Code in JSP-Files?](http://stackoverflow.com/q/3177733/1065197) and [How to use Servlets and Ajax?](http://stackoverflow.com/q/4112686/1065197)

astNode.text: By the way, you would want to review [How to avoid Java Code in JSP-Files?](http://stackoverflow.com/q/3177733/1065197) and [How to use Servlets and Ajax?](http://stackoverflow.com/q/4112686/1065197)
